author: L-Smiley
title: Healthshare Diagnostics
body:
On Friday my GP referred me for an Ultrasound Scan, and on Monday I received a text message and an email urging me to make an appointment via Swiftqueue, and giving a link. Despite multiple attempts I was unable to book, due to problems with swiftqueue, which were subsequently sorted by their technical support team. In the meantime I found it virtually impossible to get through to Healthshare Diagnostics by phone - number 11 in the call queue was the nearest I got. Meanwhile I was sent more texts and emails urging me to book, but when i finally managed to book through swiftqueue, the first appointment I was offered was in 6 weeks time - so what was the rush?  
The whole experience was very stressful, despite me being experienced in using computer technology. What hope would there be for anyone without a smartphone or computer? I am not impressed by the booking service of Healthshare Diagnostics.

author: CurlyC
title: An unhappy encounter
body: I had a brief and unhappy encounter with the Crisis Response Team - lacking empathy understanding and communication skills. I asked to speak to a manager about my experience but was simply passed to another member of staff.

author: Beccs45
title: The team were fantastic
body: I attended the Endoscopy unit today at the Nottingham City hospital. The team were fantastic and made me feel very relaxed. The team were informative sensitive and caring. You are in a very vulnerable situation whilst having a colonoscopy, however the team made me feel very safe. Thank you.

author: limaer47
title: Poor support from the crisis team
body:
Between the years 2020 to present, I have experienced some very poor treatment from the Sunderland IRS/Crisis Team.  
I have had what I found to be judgmental comments from the call handlers, when they have insisted on advising me on my mental health (when it is not their place to say or judge).  
More recently I have had a crisis team clinician dismiss me by saying how I have felt this way before, and their advice to me when making contact was to take medication. In this case, I had made contact due to feeling like I was going to self harm. I have also had a crisis team clinician dismiss my risks and tell me that I have to help myself due to my diagnoses being "chronic" Again, in this case I had made contact due to the risks I was having.  
On both of these occasions, I had made the crisis team clinicians aware that I was following my own care plan created by myself and my care coordinator. On both occasions the crisis team clinicians dismissed me and both failed to do any form of welfare check on me when I abruptly ended the call in tears.  
I have placed a number of complaints into the trust regarding this service , yet in spite of this nothing has changed. I am constantly promised that lessons have been learnt, but they continue to treat me like I shouldn't be using the service with the diagnoses I have.  
I would say that this service is not fit for purpose and something needs to change as an organisation. For example, ensuring that clinicians actually read and follow patients care plans.  
Unfortunately, from my experience, I feel there are still members of staff who work for the IRS/Crisis Team in Sunderland who judge people with personality disorders by dismissing their crises and not taking them seriously. It is not appropriate for a crisis team clincian to tell a patient they cannot be helped in their crisis due to their diagnosis being chronic.  
How many more complaints have to be put in before something changes??

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Cumbria, Northumberland, Tyne and Wear NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Family Surgery
body: Our family have been under this surgery for many years but since being taken over it’s just brilliant! The kindness and professional support from all the staff is 1st class! Always go above & beyond to help. Thank you so much.

title: Excellent practice
body:
I am receiving telephone consultations due to the Coronavirus.  I am having post op consultations and the medical team and reception are all magnificent.  I have been with the surgery for approximately 9 years.

Although telephone consultation only at the present time with my GP, unless I need a personal visit, I have all my issues resolved relating to my accident with time and compassion with regard to my condition.  Thank you so much, it cannot be easy dealing with the frustrations of cutbacks, beyond your control.

author: Feeey78
title: My ultrasound experience
body:
I went along today for an ultrasound. This appointment was Text to me. I imagined that it would involve only a scan of my pelvis. I was told on entering that it would involve a internal ultrasound.  
The clinician then asked me if I was a virgin, I was so taken aback, that they then repeated the question. I was then asked to remove my clothing from the lower part of my body, I wasn’t provided with a screen for privacy. The clinician sat with their back to me - randomly asking a few questions, whilst speaking into a dictaphone.  
I then placed myself on the chair for the procedure, the clinician then asked me am I wet or dry. They then performed the procedure, which went ok.  
I was then told to put my clothing on - again no screen and the clinician didn’t even allow me some privacy to dress, they cleaned the machine whilst I dressed.  
I was stunned at the use of such poor clinical language, with no sensitivity at all. The whole experience left me feeling vulnerable, exposed and really quite saddened.  
I work for the NHS and fully understand the pressure staff are under.  
This was an invasive procedure. I won’t return to this clinic in the future.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Fantastic support
body:
At a time where my symptoms of anxiety and OCD were getting the better of me being able to speak to a professional and gain further advice and tools to support myself are invaluable. 
From the initial referal, assessment appointment and treatment sessions with CBT therapist the service provided has been great. 
Although my anxiety isnt fully resolved  I have practical steps to help me and know if it becomes too much on my own I can refer. 
Having access to Silver Cloud online support is also a great help.
cannot fault the service provided.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust o

title: Amazing staff
body: Went here as a very nervous patient. From the moment I arrived I was made to feel welcome and looked after extremely well. Practice Plus staff are just amazing and caring.

title: Quick response
body: I was grateful that one of the doctors was able to see me the same day as my call. was sympathetic to my illness and the effect it was having on me and prescribed to treat the symptoms.

title: Worth the wait
body: It was a struggle to get through to book an appointment however reception staff were polite and professional. The GP herself was amazing and almost reduced me to tears of relief to be listened to and taken seriously. Appointment was right on time on the day and again all staff were friendly and welcoming.

title: Very efficient and helpful
body: Doctor called at advised appointment time, was very insightful and helpful. She knew what the issue was and could explain very articulately the next steps

title: Professional, efficient and friendly practice
body: All staff were friendly, polite and caring on both my assessments and appointment for surgery. The surgeon was excellent and made me feel comfortable and kept me fully informed throughout the procedure. On the way home in the taxi the driver said that the SpaMedica Centre at Blantyre Street has a really good reputation, it was good to hear that.

title: Professional Service
body: Had a nurse appointment Friday 17th June where she was very professional, patient and calm with me. She explained everything that she was doing and the reasons why, she was very thorough. More often that not people complain rather than compliment which is why this should be recognised. This practice is an amazing practice, doing an amazing job under the current pressures that Primary Care is facing. Thank you for your care. Helen

author: Relative123
title: Poor discharge process
body:
My husband suffers from severe chronic pain, together with meniers disease which affects his balance and means he is deaf in one ear. He therefore finds all transport difficult but especially busses. When he was transferred by patient transport to hospital at the request of the practice nurse who visited him at home I explicitly asked the ambulance staff if there would be a way to get him home again as we do not have family nearby and he would be too unwell to travel by bus. I was assured that the ward would be able to call for a patient transfer home. My husband did not want to go into hospital but was reassured by this. Later the same day my husband was discharged and told to make his own way home by bus as patient transfer was closed and this is not something they arrange unless it’s to a care home. I phoned the Scottish ambulance service and was told this this is not true, the ward could arrange him transport as part of his discharge. I am appalled that the staff thought it would be appropriate to send him on public transport alone and think that surely something needs to be in place past 5pm. I am well aware that services are stretched and that staff are under pressure but nothing feels very ‘caring’ about this patient care and I’m extremely upset by it.  
A word about the Scottish ambulance service - superstars! Every encounter I’ve had with them on the phone they’ve been lovely and the men transferring my husband today were so friendly and kind.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Great Patient Experience
body:
Having been registered a few years I don't often visit the practice, that said, when I have visited I have had a welcoming and professional experience. 
Primarily visiting the nurses for procedures I cannot commend them enough for their work, they were chatty & built rapport before explaining each phase of any procedure and ensured I was at ease. 
Booking appointments was easy & there have been no extensive wait times. Given what all medical professionals have been through throughout the pandemic the staff at Munro have been exceptional in my experience with them. 
Ignore what you see on Facebook as it's not accurate and says more about the patients than the staff doing their utmost to support patients.

title: Great doctors
body: Very friendly quick response and helpful the doctor I saw made me fell at ease and willing to listen which is so inportant

title: Great staff esp reception
body: Staff are always really kind and helpful, esp at reception which can be difficult as I can’t always explain myself, but they are very patient with me…..no pun intended!!!

title: Excellent practice
body: The staff have been extremely helpful and supportive. I feel that they really understand how anxious I was feeling.

title: Great service:)
body:
Had my smear test today-he nurse was so so lovely and caring !
Unfortunately I did not ask her name!
Reception is always friendly too and always respond to my emails quickly as do the doctors !
Thank you very much for the great service!

title: Amazing Staff
body: Staff were amazing, from the male receptionist, the lovely nurse & the amazing lady doing xrays. All very tired & overworked but all were patient, calm & respectful

author: xraybn37
title: Antenatal ward treatment
body:
I am going to be a solo mum by choice via sperm donor/IVF. A few weeks ago I went to the antenatal assessment unit due to having reduced movements. The staff there were wonderful and reassuring and I felt well looked after, however they were concerned about my baby’s heart rate so I was admitted to Nettleham Ward overnight for monitoring. The 2 midwives I had there were lovely, though I felt slightly abandoned (I imagine they were super busy and so through no fault of their own).  
During the evening my mum (birth partner) came back to the ward to bring me some things. This was well within the visiting times for birth partners (by several hours) but she was not allowed onto the ward despite staff knowing my situation and that she would be my partner during birth. Another midwife was sat at the nurses station and shouted asking why hadn't I got a proper partner, which I heard from my bed in the bay (I'm sure this comment was definitely about me as I marched straight to the desk and they quickly pedalled-back on the comment). Thankfully my midwife (who had actually finished her shift) got my mum onto the ward and explained (again) to staff who she was. Up until this point I felt reassured and well looked after; now I am dreading the pre and post care of my and my baby (I understand the labour ward staff are wonderful), and I will be declining an induction for this reason as I do not want to be on the antenatal ward any longer than I have to.  
This is the first person who has made me feel ashamed of my decision to have this baby as a solo mum and for not having a “partner”, which is disgusting. This one midwife (and another ward staff member who was just abysmally rude throughout) have ruined my experience of this ward and have made me very anxious and worried about going back and I now wish I was having my baby elsewhere.

author: BC63
title: Very much put at ease by the team
body:
My screening test came back as positive so had to have a colonoscopy done, was not looking forward to that.  
This was done at the Vanguard Endoscopy unit, Ninewells Hospital, Dundee.  
I was very much put at ease by the team on the day, Marie, Julia, Arlene, Liz, Janine and of course Wasif (Endoscopist) who all had a great sense of humour even when my blood pressure dropped, there's always one I was told.  
Thanks

title: Great practice
body: My GP referred me for exploration of a recurring skin lesion on the nose which turned out to be fine.  However adjacent to that was a small basal cell carcinoma.  I was referred immediately to minor op procedures and within the hour the BCC had been removed under their “see and treat” pathway.  An all round brilliant service carried out by kind, skilled staff.  With thanks and in gratitude…..

title: Wonderful treatment for heel injuries
body: My trip started with an ambulance from the Strand. Excellent staff. Cheerful and helpful. A&E was quick, professional and kind. X-ray and CT scan was painful and managed to keep my discomfort to a minimum. Onto orthopaedic department where all staff were kind beyond belief. They helped me and other patients to calm down, get some sleep and assistance at a time of very painful feet. They advised us, helped us to wash and get dressed and even to eat if unable. Their cheerful professional attitude really aided my speedy recovery. I cannot thank everyone enough.

title: Incredible Service
body: From my initial GP visit to coming to be investigated all staff have been wonderful. The hospital is so clean and I'm so thankful for them treating me. The NHS do not get enough recognition or pay you are amazing.

author: redex53
title: Implant change over
body: Honestly the nicest, friendliest and chatty reception team and nurses.

author: authenticjz84
title: Prep clinic and STI testing
body: Regular review and administration of prep including sti testing. Perfect timing, great interaction with all staff, and as always exceptionally professional and informative.

author: kelpie06
title: Teenager's visit to day surgery
body: My 15 year old daughter (schiehallion patient) attended day surgery and being the oldest on the list that day she was going to be taken to surgery last.  She has attended day surgery many times before and it is a very long day sitting around the waiting room with strangers where you have no privacy to talk.  This time however, she was given her own room and it definitely made the day more bearable for her, giving us privacy to talk and allowing her to relax on the bed beforehand.  This was one of our best experiences going to day surgery because of that and having spent alot of time in hospital these little touches can make a big difference to your day.

readBy.name: Office of Michelle Thomson, MSP for Falkirk East

title: Great practice
body: Recently joined this practice and can only praise the care my husband and I have received.  Reception, Admin, Prescription Staff, Nurses have been so helpful, and gone beyond their duties to sort out any problems when required.  Thank you you are all providing a great service, which is most appreciated.

title: Fantastic staff
body: This surgery is excellent receptionists and doctors have excellent bedside manner. I would rate this practice as outstanding.

author: Beebobby
title: Increasingly concerned about getting hearing aid batteries
body:
I'm increasingly concerned about getting hearing aid batteries, I was told I could get them at my local library but they are running short and have been told they won be getting any more in.  
Now I wear 2 hearing aids and need 2 pack of my battery type, why can't I get in touch with Audiology to find out what is happening about them and also without them I cant hear.

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Vonnie22
title: They made my experience not so scary
body:
A freak accident at home , found me needing help from the A&E department .  
Albeit a very busy night in the Emergency Department on Tuesday , After a few hours wait I was treated with great compassion & kindness from James Advanced Nurse Practitioner & Aminah within the X-ray team.  
Within 24 hours I was contacted by the Orthopaedic specialist Rob to say I needed an operation the next day .  
I was welcomed into Ward 33 by SN Claire.  
I would also like to thank Lynne , Angela HSW for there attentive care .  
William & Sam from the theatre team certainly entertained me on my journey to the theatre.  
Sorry didn’t catch any other names to thank , but Mr Cook who operated on me.  
Thank you all so much for making my experience not so scary.

title: Thank you for help with prescription
body:
negatives 55 min to try and get through on general line
Positives - prescription help with emergency script fantastic by staff once got through many thanks

title: Medical and Admin staff ' fantastic '
body: My recent visit was dealt with very swiftly with Doctors, nurses and admin all keeping me updated with phone calls on the progress of my prescription.

author: listentt56
title: Variable care experience
body:
I was in the GRI for emergency treatment and I had a short stay afterwards. I felt overall that the staff were brilliant. However, the level of care was sometimes very variable. On occasions the nursing staff were very slow to answer calls and I overheard members of the team gossiping. It was often worse during the evening when staff were talking at an elevated volume and were talking about patients. On one night shift the staff were watching tiktok videos and you could hear these throughout the ward. One of the most shocking occurrences was during the day when one staff member shouted a swear word at their colleagues when visitors were walking around the corridors. A number of staff had never worked in the hospital before, and some of these individuals were not able to give answers about quite basic matters.  
The food was also an issue and did not follow the guide that NHS Scotland stipulate. I have been to other hospitals where the proper options are available. At the GRI, the food was variable and there were only two to three choices per meal. During lunch there were only sandwiches and soup available, no jacket potatoes or anything else.  
The hardest part of being in the GRI was that the team in my ward refused to let me or anyone else leave the ward. You were not able to get any fresh air because supposedly too many people run away. This was the reason stated when I challenged a nurse on this. I don't feel it is correct to hold people without giving a solid reason, as we are supposed to not be prisoners. I really felt this had an impact on my mental health during the day, as I felt trapped. I mentioned this to a consultant, who said there was no clinical reason for me to be refused time outside. The consultant did say though, that ultimately the decision sits with the nurses, which I feel was ridiculous, as there was no sound reasoning to stop me going outside for 30 minutes in the evening. My whole argument was that I was there on a voluntary basis and would discharge myself if I really wanted to leave (which I did not want to do, as I wanted to get well again). I know this policy does not apply to other hospitals in Glasgow, so it seems like an arbitrary rule by the GRI.  
If I am unfortunate enough to be taken to hospital again, I would beg the ambulance crew not to take me to the GRI.

title: Gold Standard GP practice
body:
I cannot speak highly enough about this GP surgery!
I have always received a first class service from this surgery - prior to Covid and this has continued to date.
The initial contact with the receptionists has always been without exception polite, caring and efficient - so so important!
From that initial conversation  - I have either been offered appropriately a GP telephone consultation - OR - referred to see a GP  face  to face - all without any problems or delay.
 ALL GP interventions have been extremely professional and caring and they have  all dealt with any problems and/or referred on to other services in a timely and appropriate manner.
Thank you for providing such a good service

author: betacr47
title: Explained my options
body:
Dr Williams has explained my options for the different types of coils and help me decide on the one thats more suitable for myself.  
She was very nice and really helpful. She listened to my needs and checked my heath history etc before proceeding with the IUD.  
I was very impressed with the overall service I received from both the Doctor and the Nurse.  
I haven't seen such a friendly and smiling faces from NHS for a long time so it was great to experience this yesterday.  
Thank you so much !

title: Epic Waiting Times
body:
We have been waiting for 6 hours, and we were informed of another 4.5 hour wait by the nurse. 
We have seen several patients in the A&E voluntarily leave without seeing a doctor due to these waiting times. The only thing the staff are willing to do is move patients from one waiting room to another waiting room.

If you value your health and life, avoid this A&E department at all costs.

title: Impossible to get appointments
body:
This place is simply impossible to even speak to anyone. You used to ring at 8am, sit in a queue and then try for an appointment. Took a while but it was usually doable.

Now you get forced to listen to a 40 second message before even trying to choose appointments, only to then get cut off. Isn't even a call queue anymore.

No wonder hospitals are overrun. Receptionists also very rude and lazy. A couple of months back I called up, position 10 in queue (when they still had queues), over an hour later still only position 7.

title: Exceeded all expectations
body:
Having ripped something in my abdomen the following day I felt a lump, so rather than a strain or tear I concluded a probable hernia. A&E first thing in the morning, 0830hrs. The dragon in triage looked at me as if I were dirt - after all I wasn’t a ‘medical professional’ so what would I know about anything…..

Then I spoke to someone sensible and everything changed. The doctor I saw checked me over and straight away I was moved to urgent care. Within a half hour I was seen by another doctor and referred to surgical assessment, with the hernia confirmed.

Moved to Cherry Tree Surgical assessment ward, where everyone was both super friendly and super professional. CT scan,
chats with doctors surgeon and anaesthetist, and later the same day I was having everything put back where it belonged and closed up. Released back into the wilds of Shoeburyness the following day….

I cannot say enough thanks to everyone for their haste, professionalism, wonderful attitude - from the surgical teams, doctors, staff nurses, nurses, HCA was especially lovely and caring, porters, caterers, and cleaners. The whole team worked. Thank you! Please pass along my thanks to everyone in the chain!

David Stancomb

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

author: Jugthemug
title: My care in the medical day care centre
body: I was diagnosed with hemochromatosis, I was referrd by my doctor to the medical day care in the ulster hospital. From the moment I arrived for my first appointment the staff were amazing, and I mean amazing 💯. every time I got blood removed what ever member of staff was with me,I felt reassured and very relaxed and confident with the expertise care I received. Over the period of time I was attending the M D C I got to know all the staff and I felt that they give a 💯 of their professional care to my wellbeing. I could not thank them enough and I began to look forward to my appointments. My iron level came down to a satisfactory level and had a four month break. Just last week I went for a check up and a felt that I had never left the place. Thank you so much to all the AMAZING STAFF. God Blessings to them all. 🙏🙏

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: LaurenG
title: My dad's stroke
body:
My dad had a severe stroke around 2 months ago, he was initially treated at Ninewells Hospital and we were very happy with the treatment he received and visiting hours. This was a major thing to happen to us as a family as a whole and being able to be there for dad to support him and also being able to speak to doctors and nurses as any time was a great help.  
When dad was medically stable he was transferred to PRI Stroke Rehabilitation Unit. Our first experience and impression of the unit was not good, when we arrived there was nobody about to talk to about how dad was doing or what the facility was like/what to expect. (what treatment he would receive while there or what was offered) Visiting hours were very restricted which was very worrying for us about dads mental health and ours. When we were able to visit there was rarely anybody around, doctors or nurses to speak to about him and as dad was unable to speak he couldn’t tell us himself and was very isolating for him. We had to request a ‘ get to know you form’ which was filled out and retuned but seemed as though was put in a file and not looked at as a few days later we were offered us one or three forms.  
However we have been able to voice our concerns and some seem to have been taken on board. As dad has now started to settle in to the routine of the unit and staff have started to get to know his personality and have a laugh and joke with him. That’s great as it really cheers him up, some of the staff go above and beyond to encourage him and treat him like anyone else.  
Visiting hours have recently also been relaxed which is great for the whole family, it allows us to attend some physio sessions and be with/support him even more. Although I would say at the weekends dad does often get very down with the break in physio and speech and language sessions. Especially on long weekends such as bank holidays, he is in a room on his own and often left alone for long periods of time during these days out with visiting hours when we would be there. It doesn’t make sense to me in this day and age that we don’t have people to carry out these sessions 7 days a week.  
We still don’t often get to see doctors while we visit but some of the nurses are good at telling us how dad has been throughout the day. We have a little notepad which we use to write down any questions and often speech and language and physio therapists write notes on how dad did in his sessions that day which is really helpful as dad can’t tell us.  
It will be a long journey for us all but recently we have had a much more positive view of the unit and dads care has been really great, the physio and speech and language sessions are brilliant.

readBy.name: Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

title: A deteriorating practice
body: I’ve belonged to the practice since birth. It’s got progressively worse over the recent years, exacerbated by the pandemic but it deteriorated further in 2022. In person appointments are impossible to come by. The reception staff won’t give phone appointments unless you are crying in frustration and the email service is only open for an hour a day. As someone who is juggling multiple chronic health conditions along with mental health issues, it’s impossible for me to maintain my health with this practice.

author: Annie72
title: Everything was dealt with within minutes
body: First of all I was so terrified as I had a bad time when I was a child , but anyway first of all they made me feel so comfy, not to feel worried or embarrassed as I was.The jags I never felt , and they went through what they were going to do and I was the boss lol,stop if I was getting anxious, as I really was I calmed down with Rosemary holding my hand, Lucy the student on her last year and of course Tom the dentist watching everything. Everything was dealt with within minutes. Thank you so much I've to come up again for further treatment so I won't be dreading it the way I was, I'll always have a wee worry. Thank you again to Rosemary, hope your hand is ok lol, Tom you were so calming and you will make a great Dentist Lucy.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Alexe98
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Amazing team
body: Thank you for listening and helping. Your team have been amazing

readBy.name: Southern Health Mid & North Hampshire Division

author: Alexe98
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I was impressed
body: I was very impressed with Sophy's visit today. Her ability to perform her job in examining my mother and gathering her vital information was exceptional. She left us feeling very confident in her performance.

readBy.name: Southern Health Mid & North Hampshire Division

author: Alexe98
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Thank you
body: Great thanks to the team for the excellent care received

readBy.name: Southern Health Mid & North Hampshire Division

title: E-consult
body: I’ll tried many times to use E-consult, electronic message replied about the Date and time the GP will contact me, I’ve been waiting for then, nobody contact me. The following day  I called the reception I’ll gave my situation because I’m suffering from 3 weeks backpain without improvement in any pain reliever and the pain radiating on my lower limb, they said the GP will ring my number, I’ve been waiting the whole day, same thing nobody contact me. E-consult and reception are not reliable, kindly please improve your service give attention for every patients condition. Continues 3 weeks back pain with pain radiating at lower limbs and without improvement in pain reliever need a attention and assesment like request for Radiological services like MRI/XRAY or even a physiotherapist appointment. Please give a fair service. Until now I’m to waiting to my GP to see me or call. Because I’m still having a severe back pain.

title: This is an excellent practice in every way.
body: Very reassuring and proactive with very competent staff. It is accessible and has it’s own dispensary which is huge benefit in the middle of the country.

author: Bowser1
title: Cancer diagnosis
body:
I was admitted urgently to Beatson West of Scotland Cancer Centre in December 2021, after which i received 18 Sessions of Chemotherapy in Ward B5, mostly as an inpatient.  
The day i was admitted, I had expected to only have a consultation with Dr Brown, but was relieved to be seen, as i was feeling so unwell.  
The care and kindness i received in Ward B5 was second to none during my many weeks stay.  
The professionalism of every member of Lynsey Watt's Team and their kindness was greatly appreciated and something i will never forget.  
This was all during a time of Covid restrictions and some intermittent Ward closures, but the high level of care was maintained regardless, by dedicated Doctors, Nursing and Support Staff.  
I feel very fortunate to have been in their care and will be forever grateful for their expertise delivered at times with a sense of humour, which was also appreciated.

author: happyhappy12345
title: Helped me to accept my difficulties
body:
I have just finished this programme and I can say I really recommend it. I wasnt sure about it when initially referred as I didnt quite know what to expect. They taught me how to use zoom so I was able to have my sessions from home, this was great as I have alot of pain so it would have been hard for me to attend otherwise.  
Donna helped me to accept my difficulties and to change the way I was thinking about myself and my life. I now am so much kinder to myself and I now dont feel guilty asking for help when I need it. I feel i can control the stress when it comes on and I feel more confident.  
Ive also started to make simple changes to the way I eat thanks to advice from Dione the Dietitian.  
I cant thank them enough as Ive learned so much from them, and I am living a happier life because of it

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Xxkiwixx
title: Stopping smoking
body:
Was diagnosed with advanced copd am now in end stage but I continued to smoke thought damage done what the hell, five months back I was taken into hospital and believe I died but was revived, I woke up to see my 18 year old son sitting next to my bed,  
It was then that I decided I never wanted to see that look on his face ever again, I got someone to go into my house while I was still in hospital and remove all tabbaccoo fag papers ashtray anything to do with smoking, and I've not had a smoke since so hope to be on oxygen soon.  
I got a phone call from Hazel from the smoking cessation clinic very pleasant young lady and a pleasure to talk to with good advice and encourage ment every step of the way, it was hard at first as was allergic to the patches and the gum made me feel sick.  
I've now passed my 12 week call and still going strong Hazel has been amazing seeming to call at the times I've needed it the most sometimes just chatting about all sorts of stuff.  
To anyone trying to quit or thinking about it go for it and stick at it there is light at the end of the dark tunnel, I can now afford to indulge my hobby of model making with the spare cash I've save just need bigger house for all these dammed models

author: InspiredNHSEmployee
title: Hidden heroes
body:
Thank you to the leaders (managers, team leads, project leads and supervisors etc) at the RHC Glasgow for all that they do behind the scenes everyday to ensure everything runs, staff are supported and patients and their families get a high quality of care. Often hidden away behind the scenes, no one really sees the hours and energy you put in, (or all of the MS Teams meetings you join back to back), the papers you write and the sweat to present them and even working on call late into the nights and on weekends - which a lot of people don't realise. Thank you. Thank you. Thank you.  
[Very happy with 'Manager']

title: Appintment lottery.
body:
Tried phoning just a couple of minutes after 8 AM only to get a recorded message saying that all appointments for the day had gone. 
On a previous occasion I was hanging on for an hour only to find out by ringing back that all appointments had gone. It is claimed that telephone appintments are a more efficient way for doctors to work. 
It is not. 
On paper more patients are having appointments. In practice this is not so.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Professional and efficient service
body:
Had a minor op scheduled which I needed to cancel and reschedule which was done without any problem. 
Procedure took place as scheduled, on time and very nice doctor and nurse. Could not have been better in my opinion.

title: Disgusting A&E waiting times
body: I work in the NHS myself and to be told that we have to wait 4 hours to see a doctor is ridiculous. Especially considering this is A&E specifically for children. Other hospitals reject the children's and say please go to Childrens directly. After patiently waiting for 4 hours as told the waiting time shot up by 2 hours to 6 hours. People who came same time as us were being seen but not us. I again understand that there is clinical order but this simply cannot be allowed to continue. More needs to be down to see sick kids earlier or make other hospitals accept kids. Simply unacceptable!!

readBy.name: Birmingham Women's and Children's NHS Foundation Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Peaceful ward
body: I arrived a few day ago for an operation, and everything has went very well. This ward has been very peaceful, there is not much noise which makes it a lot easier to relax. The food is nice, portions are quite small. Staff are all really lovely. Cleanliness is very very good.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Supportive staff
body: I arrived in Craigavon and was brought to 3 south from A&E. The staff have all been really good and supportive, they are all very caring and really nice people. The food is very nice. Cleanliness is great too. I wouldn’t make any changes to my stay, everything is all good.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: My deepest thanks
body:
My wife Ann Jarvis was admitted to Rotherham District General on the on 4-6-22 and sadly died there on the 13-6-22. I would like to thank all the staff from Resuc , AMU and A4 for the care Ann received and the support I was given , it was professional and very respectful.
Thank you and god bless you all . 
Geoff and Ann Jarvis .

readBy.name: Sarah Champion's Office, MP for Rotherham

title: Compassionate, high quality mental health support…
body:
I accompanied a friend to A&E, and was impressed by the high level of care provided, and the compassion and understanding it was delivered with. 

I am a mental health clinican myself, and I hope any service user I meet will be met by the same level of compassion and professionalism should they ever seek crisis support in A&E. We were seen in a timely manner - given an extremely hectic department, all staff were kind and compassionate, they were ensuring my friend had food and something to drink, and a good level of support was put in place. This must have taken multidisciplinary liaison, all out of hours, but was all arranged quickly and efficiently. Thank you for your kind help and hard work.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The food is okay
body: The staff are really nice, they are all very friendly. The cleaners do a great job, cleanliness is excellent. I came to Craigavon about a week ago through the ED. The food is okay, could be improved.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent Consultation
body: Had a phone review of my repeat prescription my medication had not been looked at for about 10 year after a heart event. I had a call from the member of staff who did the review and he was very professional. He had read my notes and was interested in my welfare. He was very clear and explained why changes were needed. Excellent treatment. Well done

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Cleanliness is fantastic
body: I came to Craigavon and I have been in orthopaedics for a couple of days. The food is really nice and the staff are great and very helpful. The cleanliness is fantastic, cleaned very often.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Wonderful service
body: Wonderful service, Everyone I came into contact with at neurology headache and migraine department was professional kind patient and caring. The nurses make you feel relaxed and cared for. The neurologist is wonderful. I feel so lucky to have the opportunity to have my migraines cheated at neurology Hurstwood Park

title: Would not recommend
body:
This surgery is so poorly run I would highly discourage anyone from registering here. 
The wait times for a doctor are ridiculous and even then the chances of getting a face to face appointment are slim to none. 
If you call the surgery for an emergency appointment at 8am you will not get one even if you get through at 5 past because priority is given to people who physically turn up at the surgery at 8am. This is however ‘not allowed’ yet they get the appointments. 
If you call the surgery at any time of the day please expect the phone to ring and ring for at least 5 minutes before anyone actually picks up. 
I can’t say the staff are rude or unprofessional but they are very unhelpful, the attitude is ‘there’s nothing I can do’ when trying to help with an issue. No one willing to put themselves out and help you, which you would expect is standard when it comes to the health of yourself and young children. 
I have tried for 3 weeks to get a face to face appointment and have been brushed off every time.. this is for my 2 year old son who has a skin condition, which has got considerably worse over the 3 weeks. I have been told to call 111 or take him to a and e… the answer to everything apparently.

title: Awful service
body: Lost all of my me and my partners fertility results pushing our process back several months. When asked to complain was advised we would be struck from the surgery.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Caring staff
body: I have been in Craigavon for a few days now. The staff are very nice and very caring. The food is great I really like it. The Cleanliness is very good as well. I wouldn’t make any changes to my stay I am quite happy.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Wonderful service
body: Attended Whitworth for the first time and all I can say is wow, what fantastic staff they have, a credit to the NHS, super efficient and very helpful. Thank you NHS staff of Whitworth hospital!!

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant practice
body: I find it astonishing when I hear on the news and read in the papers that people simply cannot get an appointment to see a doctor. This is certainly not the case with Sherrington Park. It is relatively straightforward to get an appointment and I am nearly always seen within a decent timeframe. The doctor I see is very friendly and professional and the other staff are great too.

author: charliexx99
title: All went well at my appointment
body: All went well, and, apart from one really uncomfortable moment, completely painless. Apart from the staff member who checked my details when I arrived, everyone was really friendly.

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Positive experience with the staff
body: I was advised to come over to the hospital last week. So far I’ve had a positive experience with all the staff. The communication with GPs has been great, my treatment has been fully explained and I feel as if I’m being informed about all my care. The food has been really good, and I think the menu has a good range of options. The cleaners do a great job, my room is always kept clean and so are the facilities.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Glad the visiting has opened back up
body: I’ve been in hospital for a while now, it can get very boring in here, I’m very glad the visiting has opened now. Its great being able to see my daughter, I really look forward to it every night. The ward is very comfortable I’m able to get a good amount of sleep each night, the beds are great and so are the pillows. The foods been okay I enjoy the tea and toast in the morning. The cleanliness of the ward is great, everything’s very clean.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: My problems seemed ignored
body: I had used this service a few times over the last 6 years, it feels like you are talking to a robot not an actual human being, because they never seem to pay attention to your key points...I got discharged a month ago because my questionnaire scored quite high, they referred me to another service that didn't accept their response...i wasn't even asked if I wanted to continue the remaining session, it made me feel even worse as it just seemed I was disposed of. I ended up calling the secondary service and the way IESO had written the report didn't seem clear like it was giving out the wrong message.. in the end I got my GP to write the referral instead..the whole experience wasn't connecting or understanding at all, it literally feels like I'm talking to a bit who doesn't like their job! Very disappointed it made me feel worse and not getting anywhere.

title: Poor
body: Phoned as my 10 month baby, had high temperature for 4 days, wasn't going down, very snuffly, sticky eyes, and keeps robbing her ear. Said call will come within 1 hour, then someone Phoned said it be a bit longer as very busy, 8 hours later no call. For a baby very poor service.

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Lovely porridge
body: I was admitted via ED last week, the treatment from the staff in the hospital has been great, and I have been treated with such respect. The staff on the ward have also been very kind and caring towards me, I don’t feel as there could be any improvement in the quality of care they provide. The food on the wards been good, I enjoy the breakfast a lot the porridge is lovely. The cleanliness of the facilities is very good.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Great facilities
body: I was admitted via an ambulance, it didn’t take long to arrive, and the staff took great care of me. The nurses in the emergency department were all very helpful I stayed down here for one night. I didn’t get the best sleep as the noise levels were very high because there was lots of people coming in. The facilities in the hospital are great, they are very clean, and the cleaners do a very good job I must say. The food has been okay, there isn’t much on the menu, so maybe this could be improved.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Its a waste of our resources.
body:
My wife done online consultation for my 8 months old baby. They responded after 24 hours that information is not clear. she should submit information again. Which means we need to wait another 24 hours for their response. and response could be like "You will get a call from our clinician on next x day." then you wait for another one or two days for their call. 
If the information is not clear you should make a call and ask for info or do the advice straight away. this is matter of a baby. 
You guys need to understand we do not do online consultation for booking holiday with you. We only do it when we feel it is necessary for us to talk to a clinician. 
We had to go and wait for 4 hours and seen an out of hour GP anyway. it could save my time when I come to you with a particular timed appointment.  I had to miss my work as I had to spend 4 hours extra.

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: A great ward
body:
I came in early Saturday morning due to an infection and breathlessness. I do not remember accident and emergency as I collapsed.  
Female medical is a great ward. The food has been 1st class. The ward is very clean and has a very good level of care. A working TV would be great as I do not know how to work the remote. I felt like the physios didn't seem to care much, I felt treated like a number on a page. I am not kept in the loop of my medication or my condition.  
The staff are such a mixture, some good and some not so good. Majority are good though. They look happy to be in their jobs.  
What more could they do, there is no improvements.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The ward has been alright
body:
Came in by ambulance and into accident and emergency. Accident and emergency was grand, they had a very good level of care.  
The staff there were very nice.  
Female medical is alright. The level of care with some of the staff has been decent. It is a long day in here as they wake you at 5:30am to take blood pressure, could they not wait until like 8am or something. The food is desperate, the menu is the same and boring, I have not ate that much since I have come in.  
The staffs attitudes with some of the staff needs work, were as others is outstanding. Also some of the nurses mad me feel like a burden. The physio was outstanding he was so nice.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Not patient (client) focussed / Consistently…
body: As the proud child of 2 retired NHS Nurses and having been with the practice for 7 years, I’m sad to now be seeking to leave as the services are simply inaccessible.  There is no sense that I am a client of the practice.  It’s constantly changing rules and operations are centred on the practice staff and not the community it’s meant to be serving.  When you do get through the hours of waiting on phone or physically queuing, the nurses and GP have been professional and supportive.  However, the pharmacy is restricted and variable opening. I recently submitted repeat 10-days before expiring my supplies only to be told they hadn’t prepared and ended up needing to go elsewhere with paper certificate (which I got made up in up mins!). Yet the practice hasn’t (won’t?) sign up for the digital prescription delivery services that could ease their load and our frustrations ! Madness. It’s 2022. Go digital. Please. Hours of opening and the unpredictable and long wait times mean it’s impossible to manage your health if you’re working.  You need to take a holiday to get the simplest gp practice Related things sorted.  Text messages are received on the day that changes have been made giving no time to accommodate change.  Tests results are not available digitally (so again this drives visits to surgery and further load on the practice).  GP’s do call roughly on time but face to face consultation is a thing of the past despite the passing of covid. I couldn’t tell you who my GP is now as it’s been a succession of locums. Finally, there is no follow-up. When presenting with an issue, initial tests requested and then….nothing. You can assume tests are “ok” but then there’s no next steps established. Leaving you at square one fighting for another telephone appointment, retelling your story and trying to move it forward.  What a shame that a community practice has been let deteriorate to this position and that the practice management do not appear to have (or at least communicate) a recovery strategy.  I have reached out and offered my support as a community member to help improve. Didn’t even get a response.  My honest reflection? Shut the facility down. Invest in surrounding practices or new build with new management and clinical team.

title: Absolutely awful experience
body: Had to visit A&E department with suspected heart attack (severe chest pain). They sat me on the chair for 2.5 hrs before they managed to do ECG. Bloods were taken fairly soon within an hour of arrival. Total waiting time before I had to discharge myself was 8hrs on the little plastic chair. And at the time I was 8 months pregnant. Not going to this hospital again for sure.

readBy.name: The Queen Elizabeth Hospital Kings Lynn NHS Foundation Trust

title: poor
body: I visited the surgery this morning to make an appointment for my ears and was told that I need to telephone, this I did and waited over an hour, only to be told that you no longer carried out ear wax removal, when the receptionist had informed in the morning that you did. The person on the phone said that Specsavers may do it and that was it.

title: No face to face appointments
body:
Called  surgery at 8am was in a queue  when receptionist  answered was told no face to face appointments left how ever I could be triaged  over the phone between 9 and 12 explained I needed to see the Dr as I was in pain with a sinus infection and blood pressure was raised . Was told nurse could check blood pressure ?
I do not understand why this surgery is doing phone conversations and no appointments left when there were only 7 callers ahead of me . Asked how I book to have face to face appointment was told in one to two weeks . 
How does that help me . 
Is it any wonder that people try to self medicate .

title: Appalling Customer Service
body:
Ordered a repeat prescription online which the system failed to notify me about.  When I rang the surgery to query the whereabouts of the prescription and why I hadn't been notified the response was an extremely flippant "you should know that prescriptions are ready within 3-5 days".  For someone that uses the service regulaly this may be the case but for people like me using the service for the first time it was not obvious.
My prescription was automatically sent to Tavyside's pharmacy which is terribly slow with huge queues at all times so I decided to collect at 7:30am when the pharmacy opens.  The pharmacist didn't arrive until 7:40am and offered no appology for his late arrival.
There is no excuse for poor communication in this day and age and the common courtesy of an apology for late opening costs nothing and would go a long way to relieving frustration.

title: Absolutely fantastic
body:
They have been absolutely wonderful with me. I can't praise them highly enough. 
They are friendly, professional, willing to go the extra mile, they treat you like a person rather than just a nuisance. All in all I would give them 100 out of 10 lol.

author: julycb35
title: Virtual visiting
body: I have had numerous virtual visits, i think they are wonderful, really good for families to stay connected when they cant get into see their loved ones, just to be able to see their faces for both parties is very reassuring, and makes you feel more at ease, its very easy to use and the lady organising it is lovely.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Telephone triage not efficient
body: I called today, waited for 40 minutes to speak to someone, told they cannot help immediately that I need to go to A&E! I do not have a medical emergency, all I need is medication for an ongoing medical condition, I cannot drive due to this, so cannot get myself to A&E! I'm in unbearable pain, which fell on unsympathetic ears. What is going on? Why are we paying NI if we cannot even access medical care? I'm writing this out of sheer frustration!

author: Almond
title: Finding my parked car
body: When I came out of Stobhill Hospital, Glasgow I could not remember where I had parked my car. I went into a complete panic but with the help of Scott and Mark from your security staff the car was found. I shall never forget their kindness and consideration. I am most grateful.

author: Jammin
title: Great staff
body: I was nervous about what was wrong but staff were reassuring and made me feel better.I'm always nervous about showing my private parts to other people but I was ok with the nurses that I've seen. Looked after great and great staff x

author: Nortomo
title: An amazing service
body:
A blood test was taken by the community nurse while giving intravenous antibiotics. The next day the hospital at home team arrived to make sure that my kidneys were not damaged by dehydration. they came three times giving a Saline drip and testing blood. This saved three visits to the hospital.  
Stockport are now cutting this service which will no doubt cost more in the long run.

author: yprior2022
title: Lumpectomy & lymph node operation
body: Obviously I was nervous about the situation but from the minute I was taken into the care of the nurses I couldnt have felt less anxious. The whole experience was handled by friendly caring staff who went above and beyond to relieve any nerves & keep me calm. Fron the nurses to the various teams that dealt with me I could not fault in any way. The personal touch from Dr D'Silva & Dr Barker coming to check on me after the operation was touching. Great team of people and a credit to the NHS.

author: cheetahkx76
title: My care on the ward has been excellent
body:
My care on the ward has been truly excellent. The nursing staff have been taking such exceptional care of the hospital and are always on hand to do whatever I ask whether that be a cup of tea or a small mess being cleaned.  
The doctors I am very happy with as they have been so kind in taking their time with their explanations which have all been so clear and concise being so excellent at everything that they have done so far.  
The food has been so good and I have enjoyed everything that I have eaten. I have been very well accommodated by staff as I do have a lot of intolerances and I can’t fault their accommodation of this. I have had no issues so far and am very grateful for my care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Can2987
title: The staff are amazing
body:
I attend the above department for treatment and I have to say the staff are amazing. So friendly, helpful, knowledgeable. No problem is ever to big, they are always on hand to help and if they can’t they will try and find someone who does.  
A credit to nhs fife

title: Great practice but lacking
body:
I could not fault how professional the practice is , where it falls down is its contact system.
You can ring the practice and it will be constantly engaged. When you do get connected you can be waiting to be answered for up to 45 mins. In these times of rising cost.

title: Waste of time
body:
Phoned 111 at 10am Saturday night for an appointment at Bath street for my sick child.Got a call from a nurse at 8.50am Monday morning.  Ha ha ha what a joke?
Told her I had sorted it myself and taken him to a&e. The NHS are wasting their own money!

title: Waiting times
body: They never seem to answer the phone, every time i have called i’ve had to wait 1-2 hours on hold. By the time i have had a chance to speak to someone they are no available gp slots. It is very frustrating.

title: Booking an appointment
body: I have been with this GP practice for more than 15 years. I had no problems. However the services stats going from bad to worse, specially booking appointments. I kept calling the surgery for three days . I have kept keeping me on hold. After 20 tp 25 minutes waiting on phone the receptionists say that it’s fully booked and they can’t do anything about. Don’t tell it’s protocol as your copy and paste answers . Find a way to accommodate your patients. It’s ridiculous an acceptable. I pay tax so I have to get a good services.

title: No complaints
body: I contacted the practice via email recently.  Two hours later a doctor called to discuss my problem and half an hour after that two appointments had been booked for tests.  I was seen on time for both tests and four days later, someone from the practice called me with the results and a solution.  Fortunately, this was something I could buy over the counter.  On this occasion the system worked for me.  I've deducted one star as I did have to wait 3 weeks for the test appointments, otherwise I have no complaints.

title: Pharmacist great, reception appauling
body:
Having to wait almost a month for a telephone medication review, can't actually tell you if they are going to confirm the medication for you to have in the meantime, ask for information reception doesn't need to know, belittling attitude on the phone, just seem to want to get you off the phone. I have noticed a hernia grow in lockdown and haven't even bothered trying to get an appointment to get it checked out as whats the point, will probably need surgery on it by the time I can get seen.

When I have spoken to the pharmacist she has actually been really friendly and easy to talk to so cant fault her.
